thread.title: Palestinian teen girl on trial for striking Israeli soldier agrees to plea deal: Israeli media

title: Palestinian teen girl on trial for striking Israeli soldier agrees to plea deal: Israeli media
text: March 21, 2018 / 2:56 PM / Updated 13 minutes ago Palestinian teen girl on trial for striking Israeli soldier agrees to plea deal: Israeli media Reuters Staff 1 Min Read JERUSALEM (Reuters) - A Palestinian teenage girl on trial for slapping an Israeli soldier accepted a plea deal on Wednesday under which she will be sentenced to eight months in prison, Israel’s Haaretz news website said. FILE PHOTO: Palestinian teen Ahed Tamimi enters a military courtroom escorted by Israeli security personnel at Ofer Prison, near the West Bank city of Ramallah, January 15, 2018. REUTERS/Ammar Awad/File Photo Slideshow (2 Images) Ahed Tamimi’s lawyer was not immediately available to comment. The attorney told Reuters earlier that a plea bargain over the December incident, which turned Tamimi into a hero to Palestinians, had been offered by military prosecutors. Reporting by Jeffrey Heller; Editing by Ori Lewis
